description.narrative: 1.1 Integrity mechanisms in the judicial recruitment procedures through merit-based and psychological testing developed. 1.2 Strengthened integrity component of the judicial curricula in the Academy of Justice. 1.3 Design of interoperable e-recruitment system developed. 1.4. E-recruitment system applied as an integral part of broader e-justice system. 1.5 Existing Alternative Dispute Resolutions methods reviewed and proposal for improvement developed. 1.6 New and innovative methods to set-up new culture of communication to the profession and citizenry to re-inaugurate the image and position of the judge applied. 1.7 Public awareness campaigns on access to justice, including though introduction of new judicial and anti-corruption reforms developed and implemented. 1.8. Constitution review process supported through building capacity of the Constitutional Reform Commission and its Secretariat and strengthening CSO participation. 2.1 Package of design of efficient e-court/e-case-management system proposed. 2.2. Basic systems and capacities for efficient e-court/e-case-management system as part of e-justice system developed and applied. 2.3 Free legal aid system assessed and package of proposals for improvement provided. 2.4 Innovative Justice Forum conducted, and small grant schemes started. 3.1. Policy support package provided to CPC, comprehensive capacity building programs developed and implemented for members of CPC and its staff. 3.2. Corruption risk assessment is piloted in two line-ministries and capacity of respective bodies on monitoring and evaluation of anti-corruption reforms enhanced. 3.3. Capacity building program and trainings for AC court judges in Armenia developed and implemented 3.4. Anti-corruption education in the country promoted through organizing AC campaigns and trainings for civil servants and integrity officers. 3.5. Codes of Conduct and conflict of interest regulations in the public sector developed and adopted.

comment.narrative: 1.1 Integrity mechanisms in the judicial recruitment procedures through gender responsive merit-based and psychological testing developed. 1.3 Design of interoperable e-recruitment system developed. 1.6 New and innovative methods to set-up new culture of communication to the profession of judges and citizenry and to re-inaugurate the image and position of the judge, including gender equality and women representation applied. 1.7 Public awareness campaigns on equal access to justice (with particular focus on women groups), including through introduction of new judicial and anti-corruption reforms developed and implemented. 2.1 Package of design of efficient e-court/e-case-management system proposed with due consideration of gender responsive mechanisms and solutions in place. 3.1. Policy support package provided to CPC, comprehensive and gender responsive capacity building programs developed and implemented for members of CPC and its staff. 3.5. Codes of Conduct and conflict of interest regulations in the public sector developed and adopted including the focus on gender responsive dimension.

1.1 - Need assessment on introduction of merit-based e-recruitment system focusing on psychological testing conducted and relevant recommendations presented to national partners. - Based on need assessment, internationally validated psychological tests acquired and translated into Armenian. - Merit-based E-Recruitment system- Psychological testing portal developed and pilot testing for candidate judges will be conducted by the end of December 2020 or in the beginning of next year. 1.3. Design of Interoperable e-recruitment system developed and shared with national partners. 1.6. Comprehensive Communication Strategy on Justice and Anti-Corruption reforms developed and public awareness materials have been prepared. The implementation of the Strategy and Action plan is envisaged in the beginning of 2021. 1.7. Access to justice components are integral part of Communication Strategy on Justice and AC reforms developed by the support of UNDP. The implementation of public awareness campaigns postponed due war situation in the country and planned during first half of 2021. 2.1. Package of design of efficient e-court/case management system developed and shared with national partners, relevant feedback received and next steps agreed. During next year practical implementation will take place based on agreed action plan with Government. 3.1. - The Policy support package has been developed by UNDP Anti-Corruption Global team and relevant recommendations provided to national partners. - With the support of 2 national experts institutionalization and operationalization of CPC strengthened, as well as capacity of CPC members enhanced. 3.5. - Codes of Conduct has been reviewed by UNDP and relevant feedback provided. - Proposal on possible sanctions for code of conduct violation have been developed by national expert and shared with all relevant stakeholders. - The adoption of the documents envisaged in the beginning of next year.

1.2 Strengthened integrity component of the judicial curricula in the Academy of Justice, including with focus on gender sensitive topics. 1.4. E-recruitment system applied as an integral part of broader e-justice system. 1.5 Existing Alternative Dispute Resolutions methods reviewed and proposal for improvement developed, inter alia, addressing gender dimension.
2.3 Free legal aid system assessed and package of proposals for improvement, including introduction of gender responsive system, provided. 2.4 Innovative Justice Forum conducted, and small grant schemes started. 3.2. Corruption risk assessment with focus on gender dimensions is piloted in two line-ministries and capacity of respective bodies on monitoring and evaluation of anti-corruption reforms enhanced. 3.3. Capacity building program and trainings, including gender dimension, for AC court judges in Armenia developed and implemented. 3.4. Anti-corruption education in the country promoted through organizing AC campaigns and trainings for civil servants and integrity officers, including gender dimension.

1.2. Integrity component of the judicial curricula of Academy of Justice has been strengthened through introduction of psychological aspects. 1.4. The design of the E-recruitment system has been developed. 1.5. The design of potential alternative dispute resolution electronic system suggested based on conducted needs assessment. 2.3. The free legal aid system has been assessed and proposals for improvement suggested. 2.4. Innovative Justice Forum has been organized. 3.2. Corruption risk assessment conducted in line ministries based on methodology developed by the support of UNDP. 3.3 Capacity building trainings have been organized for AC court judges. 3.4. Anti-corruption training curricula has been developed for civil servants and integrity officers and relevant trainings organized.
2.2. Basic systems and capacities for efficient e-court/e-case-management system as part of e-justice system developed and applied, including gender equality and gender responsive dimension.
2.2. The ToR and other business processes for introduction of e-court/case management system have been developed and validated with national partners.
